comments.body:
The error with Appveyor is a mismatched quote here, not a bug in Conda-build.  `"%LIBRARY_INC`

I'm leaving the test in, but can no longer reproduce the failure.
Oops. Sorry. ðŸ˜³ Will fix that. Thanks for spotting that.

Though I must say I am a bit surprised that this only caused issues with `conda-build` on that one version of Python and went away with a downgrade. Is there some reason it didn't show up in the other cases?

I am mystified.  I think the main reason is that it is indeed a setting of INCLUDE going wrong (setenv.cmd replacing it), but the others set INCLUDE correctly (and the --include-dirs is superfluous there).  I'm guessing it is only strictly necessary for the VS 2010 build?  Wild conjecture here.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +15,19 @@  script:
    - python setup.py --with-libyaml build_ext --include-dirs="${PREFIX}/include" --library-dirs="${PREFIX}/lib"  # [unix]
    - python setup.py --with-libyaml build_ext --include-dirs="%LIBRARY_INC% --library-dirs=%LIBRARY_LIB%         # [win]
    - python setup.py install
    - python setup.py test
